title: Empowers the New York city transit authority to construct elevators for use by the elderly and handicapped
summary: Empowers the New York city transit authority to construct elevators at all elevated stations in the city of New York from ground level to the station platform for elderly and handicapped persons.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2261

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the public authorities law, in relation to the construction
of elevators at all New York
city elevated stations

PURPOSE/SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill provides that elevators for the use of the aged and
handicapped will be constructed at all New York city elevated
stations from the ground level to the platform. Section 1204 of the
public Authorities Law is amended by adding subdivision 19, providing
elevators at elevated subway platforms for elderly and handicapped
persons.

JUSTIFICATION:
At present, the only access to elevated platforms are long, steep and
often very congested stairways. This condition creates a hardship for
the aged and handicapped, in many cases amounting to an impossible
task.
Recognizing the rights of those people to proper modes of
transportation equitable with the citizenry at large, this bill
provides a means whereby the aged and handicapped may avail
themselves of elevated service.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
$10,000,000.00

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on the first day of January in the second
year next succeeding the year in which it shall have become a law.
